     No One Man to Control--In counseling for the advancement of the work, no one man is to be a controlling power, a voice for the whole.  Proposed methods and plans are to be carefully considered, so that all the brethren may weigh their relative merits and decide which should be followed.  In studying the fields to which duty seems to call us, it is well to take into account the difficulties that will be encountered in these fields.--Testimonies, Vol. 7, p. 259.
